result.execSummary:
The defendant Tariq I Abdullah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution set at ZERO.

- No Contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firarm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

- NO CONTACT with victim unless approved by the agent.
- Third party contact for the purpose of time with children.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

- Batterers Intervention program.
- Parenting classes if agent recommends.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review on 10-28-16 at 1:30pm, Br-24
**10-21-16/PRH - defendant is non-compliance with probation conditions and is ordered to serve 60 days to begin from 10-12-16; STRAIGHT TIME.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1; with credit for 7 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tariq I Abdullah

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant

Requesting a payment plan for: 16CM06, 16CT1089, 08CF5718, 07CM5497, 07CM1186, and 11CF196.
Address:  2856 S. 9th Place, Milwaukee, WI  53215.

Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court. CMC. Probation Status Review report previously received and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 60 days of the condition time to begin from 10/12/2016; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Tariq I Abdullah not in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent in court. CMC. Defendant taken into custody on DOC warrant in court. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Case adjourned for a Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Per Agent request, case scheduled for a Probation Review Hearing on 10/12/2016 at 8:30 am. Parties notified.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 2.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 months.

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1, with credit for 7 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review on 10-28-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 24.
- Batterers Intervention program.
- Parenting classes if agent recommends.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.
- Third party contact for the pupose of time with children.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact order. Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. Statements made by Lindsey T.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; Missed Office Contact.

Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Final Pretrial held. Discussion of Justice Point Report placed on the record. State requests an adjourned Jury Trial due to witness unavailability. Court grants state request. Court VACATES Jury Trial on 6/15/2016. Case adjourned to branch 24 for Jury Trial.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JUSTICE POINT REPORT   RECEIVED AND FILED    CH
Violation report from JusticePoint Program: missed office contact, received and filed.  Court takes no action at this time.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. No contact order remains. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

16RM014860  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/08/2016
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.R.T.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.    The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Tariq I Abdullah in custody.  Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
